articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Youth Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Youth Delegation
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with leading members of the Chinese youth friendship delegation led by Lu Hao, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Youth League of China, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.
					 The head of the delegation said that the visit to the DPRK helped all of them know better that the Sino-DPRK friendship provided by revolutionaries of the elder generation of the two countries is the traditional one sealed in blood.
					
					 He said that he was sincerely rejoiced over the fact that the Korean people are registering successes in their efforts to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012 under the wise leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He, on behalf of the delegation and the C.C., the CYLC, wholeheartedly wished Kim Jong Il good health.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Sends Message of Sympathy to Indian PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Sends Message of Sympathy to Indian PM
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK, sent a message of sympathy to Manmohan Singh, Prime Minister of India, on Tuesday as regards the recent flood that hit southern India, claiming huge human and material losses.
					 Kim in the message hoped that the Indian government would eradicate the aftermath of flood damage as early as possible and stabilize the living of the inhabitants in the flood-hit region.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Hosts Reception
Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, gave a reception at his embassy here on Wednesday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and China. 
					 Present there on invitation were O Su Yong, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who is chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, and others. 
					
					 The ambassador said in his speech at the reception that colorful functions held by the two countries after setting this year as a "year of China-DPRK friendship" contributed to promoting friendship between the two peoples and strengthening cooperation in various fields.
					
					 The significant celebration of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between China and the DPRK contributed to inheriting the tradition, strengthening good neighborly friendship and developing China-DPRK friendship, he added.
					
					 Noting that China-DPRK relations are now at a new historical point, he called for holding hands with each other and making efforts to open up a new chapter of China-DPRK friendship. 
					
					 O Su Yong in his speech referred to the fact that since the establishment of the diplomatic ties the two countries have steadily boosted the friendly bonds, supporting and cooperating with each other in political, military, economic, cultural and all other fields.
					
					 He stressed that both sides set this year as a "year of the DPRK-China friendship" and briskly exchanged high-level delegations and held diverse and colorful events, powerfully demonstrating before the world the will of the two parties, governments and peoples to steadily develop the bilateral relations on good terms.
					
					 Referring to the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries that have invariably grown stronger, he stressed that the people of the DPRK would strive together with the Chinese people to develop this friendship.
					
					  Meanwhile, a reception was given at the Chinese Consulate General in Chongjin on the same occasion on Tuesday.

articles.title: Egyptian Military Attache Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Egyptian Military Attache Hosts Reception
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Eslam Ahmed Ahmed Owis, military attache of the Egyptian embassy here, hosted a reception Tuesday on the occasion of the army day of Egypt.
					 Present there on invitation were general officers and officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of various countries and military attaches of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Staff members of the Egyptian embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Cambodian Embassy Officials Help Farmers
articles.content:
Cambodian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers 
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Cambodian Ambassador to the DPRK Chhorn Hay and his embassy officials did a friendship work at the DPRK-Cambodia Friendship Paeksok Cooperative Farm in Sinchon County, South Hwanghae Province on Wednesday.
					 The guests helped farmers in rice harvesting after being briefed on the monument to the on-site guidance given by President Kim Il Sung to the farm.
					
					 The ambassador expressed hope that the agricultural workers there would register greater success in the agricultural production true to the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Staff members of the embassy handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Russian Academy Ensemble Laid Wreath before Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Russian Academy Ensemble Laid Wreath before Liberation Tower
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- The Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior led by Chief Viktor Yeliseev laid a wreath in the name of the ensemble in front of the Liberation Tower on Wednesday. 
					 After placing it, the guests paid silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the Soviet Army.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Academy Ensemble
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Russian Academy Ensemble
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting Academy Ensemble of the Interior Unit of the Russian Ministry of Interior.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned by its Chief Viktor Yeliseev.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Communist Youth League
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Communist Youth League
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Central Committee of the Communist Youth League of China.
					 The gift was handed to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, on Wednesday by Lu Hao, first secretary of the C.C., the CYLC on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Mexican Figure
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Mexican Figure 
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from Alberto Anaya Gutierrez, coordinator of the National Coordination Committee of the Workers' Party of Mexico.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned by Leobardo Alcantara Martinez, member of the WPM National Executive Committee and director of the party training institution who is leading the party delegation on a visit to the DPRK, on Wednesday.
					
					 Also a gift to Kim Jong Il from the delegation was conveyed.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Lao Party Leader
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Lao Party Leader
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Choummaly Saynasone, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party and president of Laos, on the occasion of the 64th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The floral basket was handed to an official concerned by Lao Ambassador to the DPRK Chaleune Warinthrasak on Wednesday.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Chinese
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il from Chinese
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the family of Zhang Weihua, a Chinese anti-Japanese revolutionary martyr, on Wednesday on the occasion of the 64th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Party Founding Museum
articles.content:
Party Founding Museum
Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- An endless stream of servicepersons and working people of all strata are visiting the Party Founding Museum on the occasion of the 64th anniversary of the foundation of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					The museum which was opened in October Juche 59 (1970) is associated with immortal revolutionary activities of President Kim Il Sung who had founded and led the WPK.
					
					The President declared its foundation to the world in the place on October 10, 1945.
					
					While working at the building after the liberation of the country, he led the building of a new country such as the work of founding the party, army and state and the work of enforcing all the democratic reforms.
					
					The two-storied museum has his two office rooms, reception room and meeting hall which have been arranged as they were and several show rooms where historical materials related to the Party founding are on display.
					
					Beyond the main building of the museum are historical mementoes showing his glorious revolutionary history, his residence and the historic monument inscribed with the words "Unforgettable House of History" erected on the occasion of the 30th anniversary of the WPK.
					
					Looking round the exhibited data, photos and historical materials with deep emotion, the visitors are retrospecting the immortal feats performed by the President who founded and wisely led the WPK, the revolutionary Party of Juche, and thus created a brilliant example in the building of a revolutionary party in an independent era.
					
					The Party Founding Museum is a historical place to convey the great revolutionary exploits of the President to the generations to come.

articles.title: Famous Mansudae Art Troupe
articles.content:
Famous Mansudae Art Troupe
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- The Mansudae Art Troupe, a leading art troupe of the DPRK, greets its 40th birthday.
					 Since its formation on September 27, Juche 58 (1969), the art troupe has created and represented paeans to the Party and the leader and many famous songs. It has successfully conducted a thousand and hundreds of performances for functions and thousands of performances at home.
					
					 It has given over 770 performances of the revolutionary opera "The Flower Girl", women's concert group and dance group in more than 50 countries.
					
					 The troupe also wonderfully represented in colorful forms the famous songs "Korea, I Will Glorify Thee", "Song of Best Wishes", "Greeting the Sun Rising over the Taedong River", "Nostalgia", "Embrace of Country" and other songs as masterpieces of the times.
					
					 Its performances of the music and dance drama "Song of a Paradise" and dances "Azalea of the Motherland", "The Snow Is Falling", "Bumper Harvest of Apples", "Winnow Dance" and others enriched the treasure-house of the Juche-oriented art.
					
					 In recent years, too, the troupe has created masterpieces of the times including "Let Us Hold High the Red Flag", "My Love, My Motherland" and "Best Is the Songun Leadership".
					
					 Its Samjiyon Band and the women's octet which made their appearance some time ago are arousing the admiration of the audience.
					
					 The art troupe was awarded the "Order of Kim Il Sung" and has produced a hundred and scores of "Kim Il Sung Prize" winners, people's artists, people's artistes, merited artists and merited artistes.

articles.title: U.S. Call for S.Korea's Participation in Building Missile Shield Blasted
articles.content:
U.S. Call for S. Korea's Participation in Building Missile Shield Blasted
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Recently U.S conservative forces underscored the "necessity" of south Korea's participation in the establishment of the Northeast Asian missile defence system aimed at coping with "threat" from someone.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a signed commentary carried in this regard observes: This was prompted by their sinister intention to further step up the establishment of MD in Northeast Asia under the pretext of "joint defence".
					
					 Pointing out that U.S. hard-line conservative forces are busy floating the fiction about "missile threat" from the DPRK in a bid to secure a justification for building a missile shield in Northeast Asia, the commentary says:
					
					 The projected U.S. building of the missile shield is not for "defence" but for mounting a preemptive attack. 
					
					 It is the calculation of the U.S. that the building of the missile shield in Northeast Asia would help it put all countries of Asia within the sphere of missile attack and mount surprise attacks on them. 
					
					 The U.S. stepped-up moves to build the missile shield would only render the situation complicated, seriously threaten and disturb peace and increase the danger of war.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that powers in Northeast Asia will not remain a passive onlooker to the above-said U.S. moves.
					
					 No matter how craftily the U.S. is working to spread the story about the non-existent "missile threat" of someone in a bid to cover up the aggressive nature and aims of its building of the missile shield, this will get it nowhere in the present bright world.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to face up to the reality and stop the arms buildup for aggression and the building of the missile shield which would disturb the global strategic stability and spark a new arms race and a nuclear war.

articles.title: Japan's Wild Ambition for Overseas Expansion under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Wild Ambition for Overseas Expansion under Fire
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- The Japanese government is considering signing a defence logistics agreement with Australia that would enable the two countries to share food, fuel and other supplies and services, according to a recent Japanese newspaper report.
					 This agreement calls on the Japan "Self-Defence Forces" (SDF) to share with Australian forces transport of supplies as well as repair and other services for joint drills, U.N. peacekeeping operations, etc. 
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 One may simply interpret the proposed agreement as a measure of Japan to boost cooperation and assistance, allegedly prompted by its keen interest in international affairs including U.N. peacekeeping operations. But lurking behind this move is a sinister and cunning plot of the Japanese reactionaries to realize their wild ambition for overseas expansion under the signboard of an "international contribution" to "peacekeeping operations".
					
					 Citing facts to prove that the "peacekeeping" and "international contribution" much touted by Japan is nothing but a cynical ploy to lay a springboard from which to launch overseas aggression, the commentary goes on:
					
					 It is the scenario of Japan to emerge a military giant and embark upon the road of overseas aggression in a bid to realize its old dream of "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" in the new century at any cost.
					
					 If the above-said agreement is adopted and the SDF's overseas military activities and close cooperation in them are put into practice, this will spark and escalate a new arms race in Asia and, furthermore, will bring fatal consequences to the world peace and security. Japan has already rounded off the legal, institutional, spiritual and material preparations for reinvasion of Asia and laid a social base for launching it. The intensified moves of Japan to emerge a military power and launch reinvasion are rendering the regional situation tenser, escalating the danger of war and putting the peaceful environment of the surrounding countries at peril. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries had better stop their rash acts, clearly mindful that their reinvasion is bound to lead to self-destruction.

articles.title: Koreans Called upon to Have True Consciousness of Being Members of Nation
articles.content:
Koreans Called upon to Have True Consciousness of Being Members of Nation
Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- The consciousness of being members of the Korean nation serves as a basis for developing the inter-Korean relations in the direction of independent reunification as required by the times and desired by the fellow countrymen through their concerted efforts while frustrating foreign interference and obstructions, Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a signed article.
					What is essential for wiping out misunderstanding and distrust between the north and the south, respecting each other, deepening mutual trust and achieving unity is to have the true consciousness of being members of the Korean nation, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					The said consciousness is a source of patriotic thoughts and feelings to settle all problems through the concerted efforts of the fellow countrymen in line with the national interests, regarding them more important than foreign forces. 
					
					To be hostile to fellow countrymen, siding with foreign forces, obsessed by narrow-minded concept of confrontation, in disregard of homogeneity and advantageous and intrinsic character of the Korean nation, which were formed and have developed through a long history, is nothing but treachery bereft of even an iota of consciousness of being members of the nation.
					
					The consciousness of being members of the Korean nation serves as ideological and moral strength which helps struggle for the interests of the Koreans who attach importance to their fellow countrymen, not to foreign forces, and desire unity and reunification, not meeting the interests of anti-reunification foreign forces.
					
					The above-mentioned consciousness serves as an engine which helps wipe out distrust and concept of confrontation between the north and the south and achieve national reconciliation and unity.
					
					It encourages all the members of the nation to give priority to the love for the nation though they have differing ideas and isms, overcome all differences in views with such love and devote their all to the cause of national reunification with ardent patriotism.
					
					The historic June 15 joint declaration which instills the genuine view on compatriots and the true consciousness of being members of the Korean nation ushered in a new era of national reconciliation and unity in which the Koreans are dynamically advancing in the idea of "By our nation itself" and proves that only when all Koreans give full play to the above-said consciousness, is it possible to give strong spurs to the development of the inter-Korean relations and national reunification.
					
					All Koreans in the north and the south and abroad should advance the inter-Korean relations with the true consciousness of being members of the Korean nation and turn out as one in the patriotic cause to bring earlier the independent and peaceful reunification of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Works Published in Venezuela
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Works Published in Venezuela
Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's works "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" and "Respecting the Forerunners of the Revolution Is a Noble Moral Obligation of Revolutionaries" were brought out in pamphlet by the Canta Clara Publishing House of Venezuela on Sept. 11.
					The work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" published on Sept. 5, Juche 97 (2008) clarifies the idea that the six decade-long history of the DPRK is a great history of struggle and victory, creation and change in which the Korean people have defended the sovereignty and honor of the country and built a rich and powerful prosperous socialist country, weathering out the tempest of the revolution under the guidance of the great leader and party. It also explains the idea that even a small and backward country can become a developed and dignified power when it has a great leader and party.
					
					 The work also indicates the tasks and ways to accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the banner of the Juche idea, that of Songun.
					
					The work "Respecting the Forerunners of the Revolution Is a Noble Moral Obligation of Revolutionaries" published on Dec. 25, Juche 84 (1995) clarifies the idea that it is the requirement of the revolution to respect the forerunners of the revolution and principled issues arising in establishing the moral traits of doing so and developing the relations of noble sense of obligation among the people.

articles.title: DPRK Birthday Marked in Different Countries
articles.content:
DPRK Birthday Marked in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- A friendly meeting, a photo exhibition and a sports and cultural event were held in Cambodia, a photo exhibition and a film show in Libya and a film show in Ethiopia from Sept. 9 to 30 on the occasion of the 61st birthday of the DPRK.
					 Displayed in the venues of the photo exhibitions were photos on exploits President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il performed in founding and developing the Republic and photos introducing the Korean people's efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 A senior minister of Cambodia said at the friendly meeting that Kim Il Sung is the father of socialist Korea and the eternal leader of the Korean people and progressive humankind.
					
					 The DPRK founded by Kim Il Sung has made great successes in building a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, he noted, expressing belief that the government and people of the DPRK would achieve greater successes in their work to open the gate to a thriving nation in a few years to come despite the challenges of the hostile forces and manifold difficulties.
					
					 The participants in the film shows watched the evening lit by fireworks "Fireworks Heralding Advent of Thriving Nation" and other Korean films showing Mt. Kuwol, etc.

articles.title: WPK Birthday Marked by Koreans in Russia
articles.content:
WPK Birthday Marked by Koreans in Russia
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- The United Confederation of Koreans in Russia held a function in Moscow on Oct. 1 to celebrate the 64th anniversary of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 Sok Song, first vice-chairman of the confederation, made a report there to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that the Korean people are calling the WPK a "mother party", adding that this call would be unthinkable without General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They recalled that Kim Jong Il has pursued benevolent politics, all-embracing politics, regarding it as his maxim to believe in people as in Heaven.
					
					 They noted that he made sure that the WPK wisely led the struggle to build a socialist country centered on the popular masses under the slogan "We serve the people!".
					
					 The WPK set the goal of opening the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation in 2012, the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, and has led the people to the struggle for attaining it, they said, and continued:
					
					 Absolute and unbounded are the Korean people's trust and support for the WPK.

articles.title: Education in Revolutionary Spirit of Self-reliance
articles.content:
Education in Revolutionary Spirit of Self-reliance
 Pyongyang, October 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese heroine, visited the Chongjin Iron Works (present Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex) one day in December Juche 34 (1945).
					After acquainting herself in detail with the actual conditions of the works, she sat knee to knee with the workers to find the way for repairing the furnace.
					
					 Then the workers worried themselves, unable to find a way of removing tens of tons of coagulated molten iron and waste material in the furnace.
					
					 A worker told her that it could be done by the method of explosion but it was difficult to obtain explosive. 
					
					Listening to him, she said that they could get explosive if they worked in the same spirit and stamina as the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters made Yanji bombs with bare hands and mowed down the Japanese imperialists. This gave confidence and courage to them. 
					
					The workers made an oath to rehabilitate the works by their own efforts. Then she said to the following effect: There is nothing impossible if you buckle down to work with a firm determination. This is the truth we have got in the arduous struggle.
					
					 Her teachings implanted the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance deep in the hearts of the workers and inspired them forcefully to perform remarkable successes.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il envia telegrama de consuelo a su homologo indio
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il envia telegrama de consuelo a su homologo indio
Pyongyang, 7 de octubre (ATCC) -- El premier del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Il, envio el dia 6 a su homologo de la Republica de la India, Manmohan Singh, un telegrama de consuelo por muchas perdidas humanas y materiales causadas por las inundaciones que azotaron recientemente la region sur de ese pais.
					El remitente desea al gobierno indio que elimine cuanto antes las consecuencias del desastre natural y estabilice la vida de los habitantes de la region damnificada.

articles.title: En Pyongyang huespedes extranjeros
articles.content:
En Pyongyang huespedes extranjeros
Pyongyang, 7 de octubre (ATCC) -- Llegaron el dia 6 a esta capital el Conjunto Artistico Academico de la Unidad del Ministerio del Interior de Rusia presidido por su director Viktor Yeliseev y la delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Mexico encabezada por Leobardo Alcantara Martinez, miembro del Comite Ejecutivo Nacional del PTM y director de la Coordinacion Nacional de Talleres de Formacion Politica-Ideologica.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela intencion de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela intencion de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 7 de octubre (ATCC) -- En ultimos dias, las fuerzas conservadoras estadounidenses hablaron de la "necesidad" de la participacion del Sur de Corea en el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles del Nordeste Asiatico frente a la "amenaza" de alguien, lo cual parte del intento de acelerar en esta region el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles bajo el rotulo del "establecimiento de defensa conjunta".
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles y continua:
					
					Las fuerzas ultraconservadoras de Estados Unidos difunden en gran medida el faccioso rumor de "amenaza de misil" de la RPDC para justificar su establecimiento del sistema en cuestion en el Nordeste Asiatico.
					
					Tal maquinacion de EE.UU. no es para la "defensa" sino el ataque preventivo. Este imperio piensa en que si se establece tal sistema en el Nordeste Asiatico podran asestar el ataque inesperado contra todos los paises asiaticos poniendolos en la esfera  de ataque de sus misiles.
					
					Cuanto mas EE.UU. acelera el establecimiento del citado sistema tanto mas se creara la situacion complicada y se aumentara el peligro de guerra amenazando y destruyendo gravemente la paz. Es obvio que las potencias del Nordeste Asiatico no estaran con los brazos cruzados ante tal maquinacion de EE.UU.
					
					Aunque EE.UU. actue astutamente difundiendo la supuesta "amenaza de misil" de alguien para encubrir el caracter agresivo y el proposito de su establecimiento del sistema antimisiles, no convencera a nadie ante el claro mundo como hoy.
					
					EE.UU. debe ver serenamente la realidad y poner fin a sus maquinaciones del inutil y agresivo aumento armamentista y  del  establecimiento del sistema antimisiles, que pueden destruir la estabilidad estrategica del mundo y acarrear la nueva carrera armamentista y la guerra nuclear.

articles.title: Minju Joson critica ambicion expansionista de Japon
articles.content:
Minju Joson critica ambicion expansionista de Japon
 Pyongyang, 7 de octubre (ATCC) -- Segun el reciente reporte de un periodico japones, el gobierno de este pais isleno comenzo a examinar la suscripcion con Australia del "convenio de ofrecimiento mutuo de los articulos y la mano de obra".
					  Este documento consiste fundamentalmente en  ofrecer mutuamente los articulos y la mano de obra necesarios para el transporte y la reparacion de los materiales estrategicos como el combustible y alimentos en el caso de que las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de Japon realicen con las tropas extranjeras el ejercicio conjunto o las operaciones para el mantenimiento de la paz de la ONU.
					
					  Aparentemente, esto hace pensar que Japon esta muy interesado en los problemas internacionales como las actividades de la ONU para el mantenimiento de la paz y trata de tomar las medidas encaminadas a fortalecer la cooperacion y el apoyo.
					
					  Al respecto, el rotativo Minju Joson publico en su edicion de este miercoles un comentario individual que sigue:
					
					  Pero, detras de tal gesto esta la taimada artimana de los reaccionarios japoneses de realizar su ambicion expansionista a ultramar bajo el pretexto de "contribucion en la arena internacional" para el "mantenimiento de la paz".
					
					  Estas palabras, que no se cansa de decir ese pais isleno, no pasan de ser una artimana para preparar el trampolin de agresion a otros paises.
					
					  Japon trata de convertirse a cualquier precio en el nuevo siglo en una potencia militar y emprender el camino de agresion a ultramar para satisfacer su anejado sueno de la "esfera de coprosperidad de la gran Asia oriental".
					
					  Si se realizan las operaciones militares de las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" de Japon en ultramar y la cooperacion activa con ellas, inclusive la firma del convenio arriba mencionado, se promovera y se agudizara la nueva carrera armamentista en Asia, lo cual producira consecuencias catastroficas para la paz y la seguridad del mundo.
					
					  Japon ya ha culminado los preparativos legal, institucional, espiritual y material para la agresion a Asia y ha sentado la base social para el respecto.
					
					  Debido a tal comportamiento de Japon, se torna cada vez mas tensa la situacion regional, se aumenta el peligro de guerra y se pone en peligro el ambiente pacifico de los paises del contorno.
					
					  Los reaccionarios japoneses deben actuar con prudencia teniendo presente que la nueva agresion significa precisamente su autodestruccion.
